pizzaorderingsystemnetbeans

Class Canvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • pizzaorderingsystemnetbeans.Canvas

  • public class Canvas
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Canvas - a class to allow for simple graphical drawing on a canvas.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Canvas(java.lang.String title)
      Create a Canvas with default height, width and background color (300, 300, white).
      Canvas(java.lang.String title, int width, int height)
      Create a Canvas with default background color (white).
      Canvas(java.lang.String title, int width, int height, java.awt.Color bgColor)
      Create a Canvas.

      • Canvas

        public Canvas(java.lang.String title)
        Create a Canvas with default height, width and background color (300, 300, white).
        Parameters:
        title - title to appear in Canvas Frame

      • Canvas

        public Canvas(java.lang.String title,
              int width,
              int height)
        Create a Canvas with default background color (white).
        Parameters:
        title - title to appear in Canvas Frame
        width - the desired width for the canvas
        height - the desired height for the canvas

      • Canvas

        public Canvas(java.lang.String title,
              int width,
              int height,
              java.awt.Color bgColor)
        Create a Canvas.
        Parameters:
        title - title to appear in Canvas Frame
        width - the desired width for the canvas
        height - the desired height for the canvas
        bgColor - the desired background color of the canvas

    • Method Detail

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Set the canvas visibility and brings canvas to the front of screen when made visible. This method can also be used to bring an already visible canvas to the front of other windows.
        Parameters:
        visible - boolean value representing the desired visibility of the canvas (true or false)

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Provide information on visibility of the Canvas.
        Returns:
        true if canvas is visible, false otherwise

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Shape shape)
        Draw the outline of a given shape onto the canvas.
        Parameters:
        shape - the shape object to be drawn on the canvas

      • fill

        public void fill(java.awt.Shape shape)
        Fill the internal dimensions of a given shape with the current foreground color of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        shape - the shape object to be filled

      • fillCircle

        public void fillCircle(double xPos,
                       double yPos,
                       double diameter)
        Fill the internal dimensions of the given circle with the current foreground color of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x-coordinate of the circle center point
        yPos - The y-coordinate of the circle center point
        diameter - The diameter of the circle to be drawn

      • fillSemiCircle

        public void fillSemiCircle(double xPos,
                           double yPos,
                           double width,
                           double height,
                           boolean verticalMidLine,
                           boolean leftFacing)
        Fill the internal dimensions of the given semicircle with the current foreground color of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x coordinate of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle of the semicircle
        yPos - The y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle of the semicircle
        width - The overall width of the full circle of which this semicircle is a partial section
        height - The overall height of the full circle of which this semicircle is a partial section
        verticalMidLine - if true, the line bounding the semicircle will be vertical
        leftFacing - if true and vertical, arc will point left. if true and horizontal, arc will point upwards

      • fillRectangle

        public void fillRectangle(double xPos,
                          double yPos,
                          double width,
                          double height)
        Fill the internal dimensions of the given rectangle with the current foreground color of the canvas. This is a convenience method. A similar effect can be achieved with the "fill" method.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle
        yPos - The y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle
        width - The width of the rectangle
        height - The height of the rectangle

      • fillTriangle

        public void fillTriangle(double xP1,
                         double yP1,
                         double xP2,
                         double yP2,
                         double xP3,
                         double yP3)
        Fill the internal dimensions of the given triangle with the current color of the canvas. The order of the points provided is not relevant.
        Parameters:
        xP1 - The x coordinate of the first point of the triangle
        yP1 - The y coordinate of the first point of the triangle
        xP2 - The x coordinate of the second point of the triangle
        yP2 - The y coordinate of the second point of the triangle
        xP3 - The x coordinate of the third point of the triangle
        yP3 - The y coordinate of the third point of the triangle

      • fillPolygon

        public void fillPolygon(double[] xPoints,
                        double[] yPoints)
        Fill the internal dimensions of the given polygon with the current color of the canvas. The points should be given in a cycle.
        Parameters:
        xPoints - The x coordinates for all the points in the polygon
        yPoints - The y coordinates for all the points in the polygon

      • erase

        public void erase()
        Erase the whole canvas.

      • eraseCircle

        public void eraseCircle(double xPos,
                        double yPos,
                        double diameter)
        Erase the internal dimensions of the given circle. This is a convenience method. A similar effect can be achieved with the "erase" method.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x-coordinate of the circle center point
        yPos - The y-coordinate of the circle center point
        diameter - The diameter of the circle to be drawn

      • eraseSemiCircle

        public void eraseSemiCircle(double xPos,
                            double yPos,
                            double width,
                            double height,
                            boolean verticalMidLine,
                            boolean leftFacing)
        Erase the internal dimensions of the given semicircle with the current foreground color of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x coordinate of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle of the semicircle
        yPos - The y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle of the semicircle
        width - The overall width of the full circle of which this semicircle is a partial section
        height - The overall height of the full circle of which this semicircle is a partial section
        verticalMidLine - if true, the line bounding the semicircle will be vertical
        leftFacing - if true and vertical, arc will point left. if true and horizontal, arc will point upwards

      • eraseRectangle

        public void eraseRectangle(double xPos,
                           double yPos,
                           double width,
                           double height)
        Erase the internal dimensions of the given rectangle. This is a convenience method. A similar effect can be achieved with the "erase" method.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle
        yPos - The y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle
        width - The width of the rectangle
        height - The height of the rectangle

                          double xP2,
                          double yP2,
                          double xP3,
                          double yP3)
        Erase the internal dimensions of the given triangle. The order of the points provided is not relevant.

        yP1 - The y coordinate of the first point of the triangle
        xP2 - The x coordinate of the second point of the triangle
        yP2 - The y coordinate of the second point of the triangle
        xP3 - The x coordinate of the third point of the triangle
        yP3 - The y coordinate of the third point of the triangle

      • erasePolygon

        public void erasePolygon(double[] xPoints,
                         double[] yPoints)
        Erase the internal dimensions of the given polygon The points should be given in a cycle.
        Parameters:
        xPoints - The x coordinates for all the points in the polygon
        yPoints - The y coordinates for all the points in the polygon

        y1 - y co-ordinate of start of line
        x2 - x co-ordinate of end of line
        y2 - y co-ordinate of end of line

      • getSize

        Returns the size of the canvas.
        Returns:

      • wait

        public void wait(int milliseconds)
        Waits for a specified number of milliseconds before finishing. This provides an easy way to specify a small delay which can be used when producing animations.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - the number
